block.p: The five most e-mailed articles from nytimes.com/sports for July 8 to 14.
1. RACIAL INCIDENTS MAR ITALY'S CELEBRATION -- Swastikas and slurs in the aftermath of the World Cup victory. (Posted July 11)
2. A STAR FALTERS, FRANCE FADES, ITALY REJOICES -- Zinédine Zidane, the French captain, loses his composure in the final. (July 10)
3. WHAT HE'S BEEN PEDALING -- The American Floyd Landis ignores hip pain to compete in the Tour de France. (July 9)
4. ZIDANE IS SILENT; FAMILY SUGGESTS AN INSULT PROVOKED HIM -- Marco Materazzi cast as a villain. (July 11)
5. ZIDANE OFFERS EXPLANATION FOR HEAD-BUTTING -- Materazzi made him do it, he said. (July 12)
